de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.api
Class UbyStatistics

java.lang.Object
  de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.api.Uby
      de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.api.UbyStatistics

public class UbyStatistics
extends Uby

This class represents an extension of the Uby class to support collecting resource statistics.

Author:
Silvana Hartmann

public UbyStatistics(DBConfig dbConfig)
              throws UbyInvalidArgumentException
Creates a UbyStatistics instance based on the consumed parameter.

Throws:

countSensesPerLexicon

public long countSensesPerLexicon(java.lang.String lexiconName)
Counts the number of Sense instances in the Lexicon specified by the given name.

Parameters:
lexiconName - name of the lexicon which senses should be counted
Returns:
the number of senses in the lexicon or zero, if the lexicon with the specified name does not exist

Parameters:

Returns:
the number of lexical entries in the lexicon or zero, if the lexicon with the specified name does not exist

countLemmaPosPerLexiconAndPosPrefixAndLanguage

public long countLemmaPosPerLexiconAndPosPrefixAndLanguage(java.lang.String lexiconName,
                                                           java.lang.String prefix,
                                                           java.lang.String lang)
Count the number of lemma+pos combinations per lexicon, part-of-speech prefix and language

Parameters:
lexiconName - Name of the lexicon
prefix - The partOfSpeech prefix
lang - The language identifier of the lexicon
Returns:
the number of lemma+pos combinations

getLemmaPosPerLexicon

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getLemmaPosPerLexicon(java.lang.String lexiconName)
Return a Set of String instances consisting of lemma+"_"+part-of-speech, filtered by given Lexicon name.
The lemma is obtained from the written form of the first FormRepresentation of the Lemma instance.

Parameters:
lexiconName - name of the lexicon which lemmas should be used
Returns:
a set of strings containing lemma and part-of-speech of the specified lexicon.
This method returns an empty set if the lexicon with the specified name does no exist.
See Also:
Lemma.getFormRepresentations(), FormRepresentation.getWrittenForm(), EPartOfSpeech

getLemmaPosPerLexiconAndPosPrefixAndLanguage

public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getLemmaPosPerLexiconAndPosPrefixAndLanguage(java.lang.String lexiconName,
                                                                                    java.lang.String prefix,
                                                                                    java.lang.String lang)
Return a Set of String instances consisting of lemma+"_"+part-of-speech, filtered by given Lexicon name, part-of-speech prefix and a language identifier.
The lemma is obtained from the written form of the first FormRepresentation of the Lemma instance.

Parameters:
lexiconName - name of the lexicon which lemmas should be used
prefix - the part-of-speech prefix used when filtering LexicalEntry instances
lang - the language identifier used when filtering lexical entries
Returns:
a set of strings containing lemma and part-of-speech of the specified lexicon.
This method returns an empty set if the lexicon with the specified name does no exist or the lexicon does not contain any lexical entries with specified part-of-speech prefix and language identifier.
See Also:
Lemma.getFormRepresentations(), FormRepresentation.getWrittenForm(), EPartOfSpeech, ELanguageIdentifier

countSenseRelationsPerLexicon

public long countSenseRelationsPerLexicon(java.lang.String lexiconName)
Counts the number of SenseRelation instances within the Lexicon specified by the given name.

Parameters:
lexiconName - name of the lexicon which senses should be counted
Returns:
the number of sense relations in the lexicon or zero if the lexicon with the specified name does not exist

countSenses

public long countSenses()
Counts the number of Sense instances within the UBY-LMF LexicalResource contained in the database accessed by this UbyStatistics instance.

Returns:
the number of senses in the lexical resource or zero if the lexical resource does not contain any senses

countLexicalEntries

public long countLexicalEntries()
Counts the number of LexicalEntry instances within the UBY-LMF LexicalResource contained in the database accessed by this UbyStatistics instance.

Returns:
the number of lexical entries in the lexical resource or zero if the lexical resource does not contain any lexical entries

countSenseAxes

public long countSenseAxes()
Counts the number of SenseAxis instances within the UBY-LMF LexicalResource contained in the database accessed by this UbyStatistics instance.

Returns:
the number of sense axes in the lexical resource or zero if the lexical resource does not contain any sense axes

countClassEntities

public long countClassEntities(java.lang.Class ubyClass)
Counts the number of instances of a specified UBY-LMF class. The instances are counted within the UBY-LMF LexicalResource contained in the database accessed by this UbyStatistics instance.

Parameters:
ubyClass - specifies the UBY-LMF class which instances should be counted
Returns:
the number of specified UBY-LMF class instances contained in the lexical resource or zero if the lexical resource does not contain any instances of the specified class

countSenseAxesPerLexiconPair

public long countSenseAxesPerLexiconPair(ESenseAxisType type,
                                         java.lang.String lex1Name,
                                         java.lang.String lex2Name)
Counts the number of SenseAxis instances between two Lexicon instances identified by their name. The counted sense axes are filtered by the specified type.

Important properties of this method:

  • Only alignments between Sense instances are considered.
  • The sources of the alignments are not distinguished.
  • The lexicons are identified by identifier prefixes of the aligned senses.

Parameters:
type - Type of sense axes to be considered when counting
lex1Name - The name of the first of two lexicons between which sense axes should be counted
lex2Name - The name of the second of two lexicons between which sense axes should be counted
Returns:
the number of sense axes between the lexicons filtered by the specified sense axes type. This method returns zero if a lexicon with the specified name does not exist or one of the consumed arguments is null.
See Also:
ESenseAxisType

getSenseAxesPerLexiconPair

public java.util.List<SenseAxis> getSenseAxesPerLexiconPair(ESenseAxisType type,
                                                            java.lang.String lex1Name,
                                                            java.lang.String lex2Name)
Returns a List containing all SenseAxis instances between two Lexicon instances identified by their name. The counted sense axes are filtered by the specified type.

Important properties of this method:

  • Only alignments between Sense instances are considered.
  • The sources of the alignments are not distinguished.
  • The lexicons are identified by identifier prefixes of the aligned senses.

Parameters:
type - Type of sense axes to be returned
lex1Name - The name of the first of two lexicons between which sense axes should be found
lex2Name - The name of the second of two lexicons between which sense axes should be found
Returns:
the list of sense axes between the lexicons filtered by the specified sense axes type. This method returns an empty list if a lexicon with the specified name does not exist or one of the consumed arguments is null.
See Also:
ESenseAxisType
